title: Boy, 10, shot during altercation between two adults
content:
FLINT, MI -- A 10-year-old boy was sent to the hospital early Friday morning following a shooting on Flint's north side.
On Friday, July 29 around 4:25 a.m. Flint police responded to the area of East Dayton Street and and Martin Luther King Avenue in reference to a shooting. When officers arrived they found a 10-year-old boy had been shot, according to a news release from the Flint Police Department.
Police said the boy was shot during an altercation between adults.
The boy was listed in good condition, according to the release.
The suspect fled the scene of the shooting. The investigation into the shooting is ongoing.
Anyone with additional information on this incident is asked to call Detective Trooper Thomas Dhooghe of the Flint Police Major Crime beureau at 810-237-6935, or to remain anonymous call Crime Stoppers at 1-800-422-JAIL.
